5 STOCKS BUILDING THE INFRASTRUCTURE OF TOMORROW

A handful of companies are quietly laying the foundation for what‚Äôs next. The markets they‚Äôre targeting are massive. The missions? Real.

Here are the five I‚Äôm watching -- let‚Äôs get into it  üëá

5 STOCKS BUILDING THE INFRASTRUCTURE OF TOMORROW

1. $RKLB -- Future of Space Logistics
2. $ASTS -- Bridging Global Connectivity from Space
3. $IONQ -- Push for a Quantum Network
4. $ACHR -- Aerial Mobility Is the Next Battlefield
5. $OKLO -- AI‚Äôs Power Stack Won‚Äôt Run on Wind

1. $RKLB | Rocket Lab 

The Future of Space Logistics

Rocket Lab isn‚Äôt just launching rockets anymore. That‚Äôs the part the market understands -- the flashy liftoffs, the Electron missions. But the real story is what happens after orbit. While SpaceX goes big, Rocket Lab is going modular, vertical, and defense-aligned.

They‚Äôve quietly built one of the most comprehensive space infrastructure stacks in the world:

‚Ä¢ Launch (Electron, Neutron)
‚Ä¢ Satellite components (solar arrays, reaction wheels, propulsion)
‚Ä¢ Constellation integration (LEO networks, DoD payloads)
‚Ä¢ End-to-end mission services

This isn‚Äôt a launch company. It‚Äôs a vertically integrated space logistics firm -- and the U.S. government has noticed. Their $515M SDA contract for a secure satellite constellation, their work with Transportation Command for rapid orbital cargo, and their acquisition spree (SolAero, Sinclair, Advanced Solutions) are strategic positioning moves. They're not chasing margins -- they‚Äôre building a moat.

In the post-Starlink era, space isn‚Äôt about who gets up there fastest. It‚Äôs about who controls the lanes, integrates the protocols, and owns the signal chain.

2. $ASTS | AST SpaceMobile

Bridging Global Connectivity from Space

People still frame ASTS as a satellite company. They‚Äôre not.

They‚Äôre a telecom integrator, extending the global cellular grid directly from space -- not with modems or dishes, but with unmodified smartphones. ASTS partners with carriers, not competes with them. And their patented technology allows for direct-to-device broadband, solving the global dead zone problem with zero user friction.

The genius here isn‚Äôt the hardware. It‚Äôs the distribution model. ASTS doesn‚Äôt need to onboard new customers. They ride the rails of existing carriers --  AT&T, Vodafone, Rakuten -- and expand coverage instantly. That‚Äôs the difference between a consumer sell and a B2B scale engine.

Block 2 is finalized. Manufacturing is in motion. First commercial services are on deck. The only thing left is cadence -- and when that comes, the business becomes a compounding infrastructure play, not a moonshot.

3. $IONQ | IonQ

The Push for a Quantum Network

While most investors focus on qubit counts and benchmarks, IonQ is doing something much bigger: quietly assembling the full infrastructure stack for the quantum internet.

They‚Äôre not just building better chips -- they‚Äôre building the rails:

‚Ä¢ Entanglement transport (Qubitekk)
‚Ä¢ Quantum encryption (ID Quantique)
‚Ä¢ Long-range networking (Lightsynq)
‚Ä¢ Global resilience (Capella Space)

This isn‚Äôt a hardware story anymore. It‚Äôs a network play -- compute, security, and communication, all under one roof.

Yes, the stock is expensive. And no one knows exactly when quantum will have its ‚ÄúChatGPT moment.‚Äù But the inevitability is real -- and IonQ is positioning itself to be ready when that switch flips.

4. $ACHR | Archer Aviation

Aerial Mobility Is the Next Battlefield

eVTOL isn‚Äôt about flying taxis anymore. It‚Äôs about tactical logistics in contested airspace.

Archer‚Äôs FAA certification process is well ahead of peers. But more importantly, they‚Äôre years ahead in defense integration. Through AFWERX and direct DoD engagement, Archer is building dual-use mobility platforms: low-footprint, battery-native aircraft that can launch from a parking lot and move personnel or payloads in silence.

This isn‚Äôt speculation -- the Air Force is funding integration now. And in a future where ISR, comms, and autonomy all rely on agile movement -- especially in urban or denied environments -- Archer becomes the hardware layer that unlocks software dominance.

If $PLTR helps you see, Archer helps you move.

5. $OKLO | Oklo

AI‚Äôs Power Stack Won‚Äôt Run on Wind

If AI is the compute layer of the new economy, energy is its constraint. Data centers are devouring power. Grid capacity is strained. And intermittent renewables can‚Äôt keep up.

That‚Äôs where Oklo steps in.

Forget the image of a giant cooling tower in the desert. Oklo is building small-scale, fast-reactor nuclear systems that can be deployed directly next to the nodes of demand: hyperscale data centers, military bases, remote industrial sites. This isn‚Äôt a utility. It‚Äôs a power appliance -- modular, dispatchable, and built for an always-on AI era.

The Aurora design is already in front of the NRC. The Idaho National Lab site is live. And with DoD partnerships already locked in, Oklo isn‚Äôt just building clean power -- they‚Äôre building strategic infrastructure.

But make no mistake -- it‚Äôs early, and the stock isn‚Äôt cheap. The revenue timelines are still years out, and nuclear development is notoriously slow-moving. 

Still, the inevitability is real. AI won‚Äôt scale without local, stable, high-density energy. The grid won‚Äôt be enough. And when the demand surge hits, Oklo‚Äôs reactors won‚Äôt just be viable -- they‚Äôll be essential.
To be clear: $ASTS is already my second-largest position in the small-cap portfolio -- but I‚Äôm looking to add exposure in the growth portfolio as well

EARNING SEASON IS HERE

2. $HOOD -- Command Hub of Modern Investing
3. $ASTS -- Cell Tower in the Sky
4. $OKLO -- Reactor of the AI Energy Era
5. $AMD -- Inference Engine of the Agentic AI Economy

Weird that losing weight seems so hard for many when it‚Äôs actually the only thing you can accomplish by doing literally nothing, i.e. stop putting too much food in your mouth.

But ‚ÄúI‚Äôm starving‚Äù. No you‚Äôre not. You‚Äôre not starving when you‚Äôre overweight. You‚Äôre just a slave to cravings. Most likely you‚Äôre making the wrong food choices that spike your blood sugar levels causing cravings that then translate into overeating and too frequent eating.
 
Take control over your brain by making the right food choices, control the calories and the cravings will go away and the weight will drop.
No ‚Äúshots‚Äù needed. Just planning and execution.
Exercise helps but diet is the most important factor.

That at least has been my experience.

Following a surge in spring sales ahead of anticipated tariffs, US automakers are now seeing a sharp drop in purchases. 

In March, new vehicles sold at a seasonally adjusted annual rate of 17.5 million, dropping sharply to 15.6 million by May, and further down to 15.3 million last month.
